snippet: The decision to hold a new round of talks on May 23 appeared to reflect what officials saw as a serious commitment from Iran.
abstract: Iran and six world powers agree to hold a new round of talks in Baghdad on May 23, after the first meeting in nearly 15 months on Tehran’s disputed nuclear program; testing Iran’s willingness to negotiate seriously on its nuclear program was the purpose of this meeting, and decision to hold new rounds appears to reflect a serious commitment from Iran.
lead_paragraph: The decision to hold a new round of talks on May 23 appeared to reflect what officials saw as a serious commitment from Iran.

headline.seo: Iran Begins Nuclear Talks With Six Nations
headline.main: At Nuclear Talks, Iran and 6 Nations Agree to Meet Again
headline.print_headline: At Nuclear Talks in Turkey, Iran and Six Nations Agree to Meet Again in Iraq
